snippet: The N.F.L. commissioner said on a radio show that a discipline officer or a panel making the initial decision on whether to suspend a player “would make for a better system.”
abstract: NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell is considering changing his role in disciplinary process in wake of New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady's suspension saga; other football news noted.
lead_paragraph: The N.F.L. commissioner said on a radio show that a discipline officer or a panel making the initial decision on whether to suspend a player “would make for a better system.”

headline.main: Roger Goodell Says Changes to His Role May Be Coming
